openconnector

Class Axis2ConfigurationContextFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • openconnector.Axis2ConfigurationContextFactory

  • public class Axis2ConfigurationContextFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    The Axis2ConfigurationContextFactory is used to resolve Numerous temporary files created in the Tomcat Temp folder while using apache axis2 client.

    While consuming SOAP web services through apache axis2 it creates configurationContext object which leads to numerous temporary files are created in tomcat temp directory. These temp files are not removed when configurationContext object is garbage collected There is a bug open for this issue with apache https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AXIS2-3919

    The Axis2ConfigurationContextFactory resolves the problem of numerous temporary files creation in the Tomcat Temp folder while using Apache axis2 client. The problem is resolved by caching ConfigurationContext objects in thread-safe HashMap when any connector requests the ConfigurationContext object using Axis2ConfigurationContextFactory class. If the ConfigurationContext object the connector demand is already present in the HashMap, then same will returned to the connector. If the ConfigurationContext the connector demand is not present in the HashMap, then this class creates a new ConfigurationContext as per the data input provided, add it to HashMap and returns it to the connector from the HashMap. Note : Two different connectors may or may not share the same ConfigurationContext, it all depends on what data input provided by a connector when requiring the ConfigurationContext out of this factory.

    The Axis2ConfigurationContextFactory class is used by connectors/integrations which uses apache Axis2 module for consuming SOAP web services and requires configurationContext object.

        Gets configurationContexts object which uses axis2xml file to create an AxisConfiguration.
        Parameters:
        path - Location of the repository.
        axis2xml - Location of the axis2.xml (configuration), you can not give axis2xml relative to repository.
